page.title: 11Frickley Pit
page.content: The pit is situated at the end of Westfield Lane and was opened in 1905.It has the{York/Sheffield railway running alongside it with a branch line coming from the pit to the main line.This is to carry coal to the power stations.None of the coal from Frickley is for domestic use. At this particular time the shaft at Frickley is approximately{696 yards deep.The time for winding men down the shaft is 1\ mins.The winding engine is now electric.At the moment Frickley are working four seams,the shallowest being the{Shafton/Cudworth,}working down through{Melton Field and Dunsil to the deepest{Top Haigh Moor.}There are approximately 1370 men working these four seams,but about 400 may be made redundant in the near future.
